alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Hamilton; Howard; Madison; Tipton (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 31 at 11:30PM EDT until March 31 at 11:45PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM EDT FOR NORTHERN MADISON...NORTHWESTERN DELAWARE...EASTERN HOWARD... NORTHEASTERN HAMILTON AND EASTERN TIPTON COUNTIES... At 1130 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Sweetser to 6 miles south of Swayzee to Elwood to near Noblesville, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. These severe storms will be near... Frankton around 1135 PM EDT. Alexandria, Summitville and Orestes around 1140 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Gaston and Anderson. This includes Interstate 69 between mile markers 241 and 252. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 AM EDT for central and east central Indiana. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
